snippet: Government manufacturing policies must go beyond the belief that it’s better to produce “real things” than services. People value health care and haircuts as much as washing machines and hair dryers.
abstract: Christina D Romer Economic View column contends government manufacturing policies must go beyond the belief that it is better to produce 'real things' than services; holds the economic rationales for a policy aimed specifically at shoring up manufacturing largely fall into three not completely convincing categories: market failures, jobs and income distribution.
lead_paragraph: Government manufacturing policies must go beyond the belief that it’s better to produce “real things” than services. People value health care and haircuts as much as washing machines and hair dryers.

headline.seo: Do Manufacturers Need Special Treatment? - Economic View
